name: cypress
description: The Nx Plugin for Cypress contains executors and generators allowing your workspace to use the powerful Cypress integration testing capabilities.

schema.title: Add Cypress Configuration to the workspace
schema.description: Add Cypress Configuration to the workspace.

schema.title: Create Cypress Configuration for the workspace
schema.description: Create Cypress Configuration for the workspace.

project.description: The name of the frontend project to test.

baseUrl.description: The address (with the port) which your application is running on.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the e2e project?

directory.description: A directory where the project is placed.

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

standaloneConfig.description: Split the project configuration into `<projectRoot>/project.json` rather than including it inside workspace.json.

generators.name: cypress-component-project

schema.title: Set up Cypress component test for a project

examples.description: Add cypress component testing to an existing project named my-cool-lib
Add Cypress component testing to an existing project that already has a Cypress component testing enabled. Helpful to reset the configuration to the default.

project.description: The name of the project to convert
project.x-prompt: What project should we add Cypress component testing to?

componentType.x-prompt: What framework is being used in this project?

compiler.description: Which compiler is being used in the existing project?

force.description: Overwrite an existing cypress component test project. This is helpful if you want to reset to the default configurations.

generators.description: Set up Cypress Component Test for a project

examples.description: Convert all e2e projects in the workspace to Cypress 10

project.description: The name of the project to convert

all.description: Convert all projects in the workspace

generators.name: cypress-component-test-file

schema.title: Add Cypress Component test file to project

project.x-prompt: What is the name of the project for this component test file?

name.description: The name of the component to be tested
name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the component test file?

componentType.x-prompt: What framework is being used in this project?

directory.description: The directory where the component test file should be created from the projects source root

generators.description: Create a Cypress component test for a given component

schema.title: Cypress Target
schema.description: Cypress target option for Build Facade.

cypressConfig.description: The path of the Cypress configuration json file.

watch.description: Recompile and run tests when files change.

tsConfig.description: The path of the Cypress tsconfig configuration json file.

devServerTarget.description: Dev server target to run tests against.

headed.description: Displays the browser instead of running headlessly. Set this to `true` if your run depends on a Chrome extension being loaded.

headless.description: Hide the browser instead of running headed (default for cypress run).

exit.description: Whether or not the Cypress Test Runner will stay open after running tests in a spec file.

key.description: The key cypress should use to run tests in parallel/record the run (CI only).

record.description: Whether or not Cypress should record the results of the tests.

parallel.description: Whether or not Cypress should run its tests in parallel (CI only).

baseUrl.description: The address (with the port) which your application is running on.

browser.description: The browser to run tests in.

env.description: A key-value Pair of environment variables to pass to Cypress runner.

spec.description: A comma delimited glob string that is provided to the Cypress runner to specify which spec files to run. i.e. `**examples/**,**actions.spec**`.

copyFiles.description: A regex string that is used to choose what additional integration files to copy to the dist folder.

ciBuildId.description: A unique identifier for a run to enable grouping or parallelization.

group.description: A named group for recorded runs in the Cypress dashboard.

ignoreTestFiles.description: A String or Array of glob patterns used to ignore test files that would otherwise be shown in your list of tests. Cypress uses minimatch with the options: `{dot: true, matchBase: true}`. We suggest using https://globster.xyz to test what files would match.

reporter.description: The reporter used during cypress run.

reporterOptions.description: The reporter options used. Supported options depend on the reporter.

testingType.description: Specify the type of tests to execute.

tag.description: A comma delimited list to identify a run with.
